data.title: Tom Weston
data.meta_description: Actor Tom Weston-Jones was born in Britain and has acted in films and television shows. He is well-known thanks to his parts in Dickensian, Not Safe for Work, Cooper, and other films. Twelve episodes of the television series Impossible Railways have been directed by him.
data.text:
Who is Tom Weston-Jones?

Actor Tom Weston-Jones was born in Britain and has acted in films and television shows. He is well-known thanks to his parts in Dickensian, Not Safe for Work, Cooper, and other films.

Twelve episodes of the television series Impossible Railways have been directed by him.

What is the Net Worth of Tom Weston-Jones? Salary, Earnings

Sources estimate Tom Weston-Jonesâ net worth to be $2 million in 2024. Tom Weston-Jonesâs yearly salary is disregarded. At the moment, he has accrued fifteen acting credits.

Where was Tom Weston-Jones born? Ethnicity, Nationality, Family, Education

On June 29, 1987, in Burton upon Trent, Staffordshire, England, he was born Thomas Weston Jones. Likewise, his fatherâs name is Nick, and his motherâs name is Irma.

His mother teaches acting, and his father does also. Tom Weston-Jones also has English ancestry and two siblings.

He has a brother named Ben and a sister named Bethan. Regarding his education, he first enrolled at Dubai College before going to Royal Holloway University in London.

From the latter, he graduated with a degree in drama. He also attended the Bristol Old Vic Theatre School for his studies.

Thomas Weston-Jones is six feet tall on average and weighs eighty kilograms. He also has brown hair, blue eyes, and a toned physique

How did Tom Weston-Jones start his Professional Career?

Tom has made several film appearances as a star. He debuted in the television movie The Night Watch as Jack Brown. Afterward, he made an appearance in the TV show Spooks as Sasha Gavrik.

Shadow and Bone (3 episodes) as Richard Lee; Warriors (27 episodes) as General Zlatan; Troy: Fall of a City (8 episodes) as Hector Dickensian (20 episodes) as Meriweather Compeyson Copper (23 episodes) as Kevin Corcoran; World Without End (8 episodes) as Merthin
